intro: Galium jordanii subsp. fleurotii, commonly known as Jordan's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Galium jordanii subsp. fleurotii is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
